definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

Spring Willow Society, pioneering Chinese theatrical company set up in Tokyo in 1906, part of New Culture Movement 新文化運動|新文化运动[Xin1 Wen2 hua4 Yun4 dong4], continued in China from 1912 as 新劇同志會|新剧同志会[Xin1 ju4 Tong2 zhi4 hui4]

sentences.english: The social effect of an evening of one-on-one theatre is interesting.
sentences.chinese: 这一夜一对一剧场的社会反响很有意思。

sentences.english: Think small, dream big. A simple space sparking off infinite possibilities.
sentences.chinese: “小剧场”的演出发生在一个简朴的空间。

sentences.english: On entering the amphitheatre , new objects of wonder presented themselves.
sentences.chinese: 走进剧场，在不知道自己提出新的对象。

sentences.english: This large amphitheater is one of several in Pompeii.
sentences.chinese: 图上所示就是庞贝城几座较大的剧场之一。

sentences.english: In theaters, the loft is the area above and Behind the proscenium .
sentences.chinese: 剧场里的阁楼是在台口上面和后面的区域。

sentences.english: It's next to the People's Cinema.
sentences.chinese: 它在人平易近影剧场隔邻。

sentences.english: Have you ever seen in a group of people in the theatre to an audience that crosstalk?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾看到德云社一群人在剧场里给一位观众说相声？

sentences.english: In early days, women were forbidden to enter theatres, so all Peking Opera performers were men.
sentences.chinese: 早时妇女不准进剧场，所以京剧演员都是男的。

sentences.english: It will be the biggest temporary indoor theatre in the Expo site. Its components can also be easily dissembled and rebuilt at another location.
sentences.chinese: 这一临时剧场的另一特点就是可拆卸和迁移。

sentences.english: This was originally a term used in the theater.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个源自剧场的惯用语。

sentences.english: People huddled around the theatre in order to have a look at her beauty.
sentences.chinese: 人们聚集在剧场的周围，以便一睹她的芳容。

sentences.english: The ancient Roman ampthitheatre set in modern central Amman.
sentences.chinese: 安曼现代化城区里的古罗马露天剧场。

sentences.english: In the past, there were no rehearsal halls and dance theatres specialized for dancers.
sentences.chinese: 过去，没有专门的舞蹈排练厅和舞蹈剧场。

sentences.english: TTP teacher Shu Zhuang rehearse with her students for the last time before their big performance.
sentences.chinese: 实践剧场的淑庄老师跟学生们做最后的排练。

sentences.english: All Theatre Art Association's Co Artistic Director, Hoi Chiu.
sentences.chinese: 全剧场艺术总监海潮演出风格独特的沙画。

sentences.english: I remember meeting you one evening at the Capital Theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我记得有一天晚上在首都剧场遇到你。

definition: to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
(of a play, movie etc) to begin
to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture
maiden stage role/first performance/first public showing
Lai Shengchuan (1954-), US-Taiwanese dramatist and director
